articles.headline: FIRST VENTURE Finding racial tilt in arrests
articles.summary: Dave Moore explores the racial imbalance in juvenile arrests in Columbia, Mo., finding that African American youths are disproportionately arrested compared to their white counterparts.

articles.headline: PEACE CORPS Analysis exposes attacks on volunteers
articles.summary: An investigation uncovers the increasing rate of violent attacks, including rapes, against Peace Corps volunteers, predominantly young women serving overseas.

articles.headline: SPOTLIGHT: ELECTIONS Using CAR to cover the vote
articles.summary: Megan Clarke highlights how journalists are using computer-assisted reporting to uncover deeper insights into the 2004 elections beyond basic campaign finance.

articles.headline: Getting a handle on federal campaign cash
articles.summary: A guide on how journalists can track and analyze the twisted and complex money trails in the federal campaign finance system under the Bipartisan Campaign Reform Act.

articles.headline: Finding data for state elections
articles.summary: An examination of the challenges and methods for journalists to track and analyze state election finance data, highlighting inconsistencies across states.
